bio:treatment.description: Sheath bases sparsely hairy, hairs papillose-based. Spikelets 2.3-4.6 mm. Glumes usually longer than the florets; lemmas 2.1-3.9 mm, faintly 3-veined; paleas 2.1-4 mm. Fruits 1.1-2 mm.
bio:treatment.discussion: Sporobolus vaginiflorus var. ozarkanus grows primarily in the central and southeastern United States.
